channel.title: Uncaged monkeys in a night of 400 billion stars
channel.description:
I went to watch them recently (Brian cocks, bunch of other people who I forgot the name of) I would recommend you watch it! Tickets are only £30 if you live in the UK, and I don't know where else they do shows.
Absolutely hilarious, I shall outline my experience!
Firstly, it's a science lecture but has comedy integrated into it, scientists will come on and do serious lectures but then you will get a comedian (and the presenter is quite funny as well).
Tim Minchin is the comedian and is outstanding, here is some videos of him:
He does different stuff every time, when I went he did:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jMNEP6Vwqs0&
Funny thing is, a lot of religious people went there and he sang this TWICE:
http://www.youtube.com/verify_age?next_url=http%3A//www.youtube.com/watch%3Fv%3DfHRDfut2Vx0%26feature%3Dplayer_embedded

item.title: Uncaged monkeys in a night of 400 billion stars
item.dc:creator: @katagrera katagrera
item.description:
@katagrera wrote:

One thing that was annoying was when they referred to religion a lot in a comical way, I wouldn't of cared but their argument before hand was rubbish.They attacked the higher power point of view based on one religion, then proceeded to saying that it created itself randomly one day with no stimulus, would love to know how Mr. Cocks knows these things because he wasn't providing much evidence. Which is rather ironic considering they were bashing others comically for not following scientific methods and providing proof. Typical science lecture, bash religion on no grounds of proof.

Read full topic
item.source: Uncaged monkeys in a night of 400 billion stars
